messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Maryland was knowing what is going on in schools
messages.msgSnippet: What about Clonlara?  Don t they cover MD?  Worth getting the supervisor off one s back... be well, Rachel Ann ... From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
messages.messageBody:
What about Clonlara? Don't they cover MD? Worth getting the supervisor
off one's back...

be well,
Rachel Ann



-------Original Message-------

From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thursday, December 19, 2002 09:44:44
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Maryland was knowing what is going on in
schools

In a message dated 12/19/02 8:21:32 AM Eastern Standard Time,
scribblers2@... writes:

> . As for umbrella schools, I think in MD they're religious,
> and I don't want to spend the money

They have to be underwritten by a church but many have no religious
requirements or even mention religion. The one I'm in doesn't, and it's only

$75 per year. I have a friend review me.
I try to talk them up as much as possible, particularly with the current
climate. I think it sends a message to the state when more and more people
say we are completely getting out of the system and taking the government
oversight AWAY.
Elissa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
